Reviews.Title: “Not bad but the rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Lozzie82
Reviews.Content: Plenty of space in the 1-bedroom apartment, need to have the bathroom renovated. Great location, quiet and parking is available. A shame extra payment is required for wi-fi and parking. Comfortable set-up.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: We were looking for affordable (for Sydney anyway) accomodation within a short walking distance of the bridge, Opera House and The Rocks. The York fits the bill and our two bedroom apartment was spacious and clean. The York is not a luxury hotel (strangely there are mirrors everywhere!!) but it's perfect for families. We were quite high up and had no problems at all with road noise. The Japanese restaurant next door was very nice. Staff at The York were very friendly and helpful. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Excellent Service but Poor Internet connection”
Reviews.Author: Seanyw
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, staff really looked after me and had good night's sleep at this hotel. I arrived on a late flight but checking in at 11pm was no problem. Reception and night porter staff were very helpful during my two night stay on business. Rooms were big for Sydney, clean. Although they is no breakfast onsite I found the Breakfast on the Go package in the fridge very useful. For a few dollars you get fruit, cereal, milk and pastry in a neat fresh pack. Great idea! Price of mini bar was not too expensive. Good experience all round and good for business or holiday. My only one gripe is the free Internet I was given. It is not worth it. The free wifi internet was very slow and only good for reading emails. You wouldn't be able to watch anything with any multimedia content like youtube or tv streams. I ended up using my 4G mobile Internet from Telstra. I will be staying there again next time I on business in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location! Deluxe Two Bedroom apartment; plenty of space for 4 adults”
Reviews.Author: HirschAustralia
Reviews.Content: Deluxe Two Bedroom apartment; plenty of space for 4 adults. We had an open plan kitchen, lounge dining area and balcony over looking a small park; there was a second balcony in the room with the Queen bed with a TV. Air conditioning in all 3 rooms. Very large, spacious apartments. Living area to the left of the entrance and bedrooms, bathroom to the right. Very happy with the great, central location: easy short walk to â€˜The rocksâ€™, Circular Quay, Opera House/Harbour Bridge and of course night life on George St and Wynyard train station. We met up with friends before heading out. The apartment could easily accommodate 10 for a brief catch up and drinks before dinner. Parking was safe and cheap, access by Margaret St near the Travelodge. Easy to find and drive to/from. Nice Japanese restaurant nearby and â€˜Barramundiâ€™ breakfast cafÃ© across the street. There was a Woolworths on Margaret St. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Cleaning lady was lovely, apartment was serviced daily. No drama leaving bags with the concierge on the final day to do some sightseeing before heading off later that day. We were on a high floor so didnâ€™t have a problem with noise. The trade off for a bit higher price for the central location and ability to walk everywhere was well worth it for me. Would highly recommend and happily stay again with a group.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience in a hotel and i have travelled the world”
Reviews.Author: yasman150
Reviews.Content: i stayed their in december 2011 was not told the spa was not working and the pool was not warm. I specifically asked these questions because of a bad back and needs these facilities. I could have stayed down the road for alot less money without these facilities if i had been told what i wanted to know. the balcony door nearly broke my back trying to open it the unit was so old and dated and in bad repair. I sent an email some months ago complaining about this but was ignored. I want everybody to know that this establishment does not care about customers

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Maureen P
Reviews.Content: If your are a tourist and in Sydney for sightseeing then this hotel is a great place to stay, accommoation is very spacious, superbly equiped and stylishly furnished. Hotel is a minute away from Wynyard Rail and Bus Exchange, less than 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Opera House etc - could not be more perfect in terms of location. We had a very spacious studio with large kitchen, a dining area and lovely seating area. There was also a washing machine and dryer. Hotel staff were welcoming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. An added bonus for a central city hotel is that it has an outdoor roof top swimming pool - pefect for cooling down after a day sightseeing in the hot sunshine. We stayed 6 nights and it was perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Spanishtraveller
Reviews.Content: very central hotel, 10 minute walk to Circular key . The deluxe room with separate lounge and bedroom was well fitted out and had a nice corner balcony . Ours had a dishwasher , washing machine , tumble dryer , electric hob and fridge /freezer . It made for a very enjoyable 6 night stay , not cheap but good value . Nice outdoor pool which seemed to be rarely used .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Jez
Reviews.Content: I'd read mixed reviews on this place, but I wanted a 2 bedroom apartment within walking distance to circular Quay and this place delivered. The staff were fabulous, very helpful and friendly. Parking was safe and cheap for the city. We had the deluxe room, and it was very roomy with air con in both bedrooms and the lounge. It would be a great spot for a long term stay with everything needed. My only complaint would be the shower had obvioulsy not been cleaned (hair in the drain). If you stay, head across the road for beakfast at "barramundi", as recommended by staff.

Reviews.Title: “superb location for Sydney with lovely pool all within walking distance of teh main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Bmwroadster
Reviews.Content: we decided to opt for a tp floor pent house between 4 of us rather than 2 rooms each, so pleased it was superb with 2 balconies looking over Sydney harbour and a fully fitted kitchen, lounge and dining room and 2 bathrooms, the lounge had sofas and seats for 8 people, wifi was chargeable at $10 a day, washing machine and tumble dryer were also buuilt in along with fridge and freezer. teh pool is on teh 3rd floor and also had a whirl pool spa bath, from teh out side thsi looks like a boring red brick building even teh public area was spartan but when you opened teh room into the bedroom it took our breath away teh balcony one side accommodated 8 poeple so we sat and drank and ate outside watching the sky go red, the location is up a slight hill but literally 4 mins walk from Circular Quay

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family.”
Reviews.Author: MattandCo
Reviews.Content: We've just returned home from a quick 3 night trip to Sydney to climb the Harbour Bridge. I had been monitoring Trip Advisor religiously, and worried because of some of the reivews. They were either glowing, or really terrible. After staying at The York, I assume that the apartments are all privately owned, and some may be better than others. Ours certainly exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a deluxe executive suite on the 22nd floor. The main reason we decided to stay here was because, with 2 teenage boys, most hotels would offer 2 queen beds in a room (they don't want to share a bed!), or interconnecting rooms (double the price). A serviced apartment was certainly a better move. We entered the apartment and straight ahead was the living room, to the left was a bedroom for the boys, and to the right (down a short hall) was the master bedroom. The master bedroom had a large ensuite next to it, with a double sink, bath, shower and loo. Next to that was a laundry with washing machine and dryer. Other reviews have said appliances were noisy, however this was not the case in this particular room. Walking forward from the front door, you pass the 2nd bathroom on the right, and walk into the main living area. It has a full kitchen with appliances (toaster, saucepans etc). A large L shaped couch with TV. To the right of the living room is a rectangle table with 6 chairs. A little further to the right, behind sliding doors, is an office with desk, chair and couch. The kids room had its own veranda with table and 4 chairs, where we had breaky! The living room had a veranda with a table and 2 chairs. We had a lovely view of Lavender Bay. There were certainly buildings in the way, but, hey, it's the city. At night it was lovely. Friday afternoon we walked to Darling Harbour and had lunch, then that night we walked down to the bridge and did the climb. Saturday, we walked down to the market at the Rocks and then to Circular Quay to catch a ferry to Pyrmont, the monorail around and walked back to the unit. It was a great location and gave us the opportunity to visit many sites without need for a car. After each trip out, we enjoyed a swim in the beautiful pool on the 6th floor, and soaked in the spa. There was also a sauna and gym. We would recommend this apartment to friends and family, but perhaps suggest they stay in that particular unit or at least book the deluxe executive. I believe the executive all face the front of the building. On the down side...I would be careful with little kids. The verandas do have pot plants and chairs. You can lock the sliding doors, but there are not locks up high, so you would need to be vigilant. Again, this was in this particular unit, others may be different.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: goingawayy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with 2 girlfriends start of feb (2012) for 4 nights.I found it to be fairly big and the bathrooms were nice. the main bedroom was very big and the 2nd was abit small but you're only really in there for sleeping so that was fine. Lounge room had room to move and the kitchen wasnt tiny either. It had everything you need and we got our rooms service everyday with new towles. didnt get any new shampoo etc in our stay just what was there when we go there. I'm sure you could ask for more if you needed it.everything seem pretty clean, also had a big balcony. At night i found it to be abit noisy with all the cars, we were on the 15th floor so im sure the higher you are the less it would be. it wasnt to bad, im just a light sleeper. Which it never once woke me up just getting to sleep. that was only the first night so could of been still working on Perth time. The location was great, could walk to most things. the place it self, i was pretty happy with and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC...”
Reviews.Author: Blackcard2273
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this property for the 3rd time, the location is great its 10 mins to anywhere you wish to see in the CBD. Im not sure what the other review experienced however we had nothing but freindly and professional service. We had several requests and each time we were responded to efficiently. The rooms are the biggest you will find anywhere and we stay in the city on business and pleasure often. When we travel with our baby we wont stay anywhere else. The space, the kittchen and the laundry are fantastic. The room was cleaned everyday without an issue they even accomodated our sleeping baby and returned when she was awake. Some rooms are better than others and we dont book the standard rooms, only deluxe but you get what you pay for I guess. No hesitation in recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Ami H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my husband. Our room was luxurious, comfortable bed, great location, and the service was excellent. The staff were extremely accomodating and gave us great recommendations on where to eat. The building is a two-minute walk from Wynyard Station, and about a five-minute walk from The Rocks and Circular Quay. We will definitely be staying there again next time we're in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katemno4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. I did so much walking in the two days I was in Sydney - didn't need to catch transport anywhere. The refurbished one bedroom apartment wasn't as new as I'd hoped for but it was clean and comfortable, albeit a little worn. Also, Sydney had had quite a lot of rain a few days before and my balcony was flooded. It was like having my own paddling pool! But overall a satisfying stay. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and efficient. The Sydney Morning Herald in the morning was a nice touch. Not a spectacular view. I stayed on the 14th floor and could see a nice old church but not the harbour bridge - only the approach to the toll gate. A good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: I traveled half way around the world only to be accomodated in an old, filthy smelling excuse for a room. I will never recommend such a place especially for the exorbitant price and nothing to go along with it, even had to call for soap and towels each day. Had a balcony with an air conditioning unit running continuosly so the noise and heat made sitting outside totally unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & team to match!”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the York and now can't believe I haven't tried it before. The service friendliness, standard of large apartments and location make it a perfect place for business or pleasure. I can't fault anything and was even more pleasantly surprised to have a selection of decent Japanese restaurants on the door step! Stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Customer service disaster”
Reviews.Author: hsaunders782
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the York sure know how to make their guests feel unwelcome. There was an issue with my room and my early check-in wasn't available. Bit of a disaster after a long haul flight and I needed to get to the office asap. Rather than apologize and help find solutions they treated me like I was an irritation. The staff made me feel as if it was my fault and I had to shower & shave in the pool room and dry myself with a t-shirt! I needed to iron a shirt for work - but was not allowed near a room despite plenty being available and they proposed I pay them to do it for me. What a shocker. Really bad start to my trip to Sydney! Please avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Summer in the city" promo not what it appears!”
Reviews.Author: coffee01
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend in Sydney at The York, and having booked under the 'Summer in the city' promotion we were expecting the advertised upgrade to a deluxe apartment. However, when we arrived we were allocated a dirty, shabby room with stained, worn carpets and fixtures and fittings that had definitely seen better days. When we spoke to reception we were told there were no deluxe apartments available and the offer was only available 'if' there was availability. We persisted, and finally were told we could move to a deluxe apartment for our second night - gee, how kind! We would most definitely NOT have booked this hotel if it were not for the upgrade and I wouldn't recommend anyone to stay in the un-refurbished rooms. As someone else has said in their review, the fridge (which is in the room) is so noisy it keeps you awake, as does the loud 'Ding Dong' every time the lift arrives! The light switches and sockets are so dirty you don't want to touch them, and I don't think anyone has ever cleaned the skirting boards which are black with dust etc. In both apartments holes had been punched in doors and then filled and shabbily painted. On the plus side(!), the location is good - just 10 mins walk to The Rocks and The Wharf. And the pool looked clean and inviting, though we didn't get time to use it. In my opinion this hotel is WAY overpriced for the standard of the accommodation, and the apartments all need to be fully refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen203
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and OMG is it horrible. From the moment I stepped into the elevator I knew I was in trouble. Worn stained carpet, the hallways are old and more horribly worn carpet. The room has the same old stained carpet, marked up walls. Cant even describe how disappointed i am. Will have to endure for to ight and move somewhere else tomorrow. Gross dont stay here!! Come on owner update the place it's. Beyond terrible. Amazed the amount I am paying for such a dump. What a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: The room was generally ok: big enough and clean. Now every single machine in that apartment was a noise maker, I had to switch off the fridge every night in order to get some sleep and not to mention the air conditioning. It happened to be loud and also make the annoying beep beep whenever turned on and off, well, it went all crazy on us. We did not touch the remote and it keep switching on and off and on and off randomly, not so fun in the middle of the night. I complained, the said they had sent someone when around midnight the thing goes crazy again, I call reception they told me it was middle of the night and there was nothing they could do. I ended switching the major switch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartments in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: janeetravel
Reviews.Content: York Apartments are in a great location easy walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, The Opera House and you are right in the city. We had a 2 bedroom deluxe apartment which was very spacious and had a good size balcony with table and chairs on it. Rooms were all a good size, and furnished well. The apartments has a small outdoor pool which we used also which was great after hot days sightseeing. Eating wise they don''t have their own restaurant but the Travelodge Wynyard is next door if you want a buffet breakfasst, there is a couple of Japanese noodle bars next to the lobby. Starbucks is walking distance, we ate at the Barvarian Bier Cafe on York St, 5 min walk away, and Circular Quay which is 5 min away. The building has 28 floors so if you don't like heights or lifts suggest you ask for a lower floor, the lift is slow. Noise wise you are in the heart of the city, there will be noise where ever you stay, it didn't bother us much at all. If you have a small family or a few people this is a great option instead of two hotel rooms, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the city by foot”
Reviews.Author: Kiwisarm
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 adults stayed in a two bedroom apartment , the only downside was that the second bedroom was quite small , although the rest of the apartment was extremely spacious . We were easily able to get around the city from this great location , with early morning walks including around Darling Harbour / Walsh Bay and across the Harbour Bridge ( great views from the tower ) . We found the staff very helpful when needed and would happily stay at The York again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ShaziS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is excellent if you want to be within walking distance of the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the City. The apartments have been refurbed quite tastefully and have a fully equipped kitchen, modern bathrooms, laundry, comfortable beds and good size balconies. I didnâ€™t have a view, only a glimpse of the bay, however the hotel isnâ€™t surrounded by other hotels so you can sit on the balcony and it feels quite private. This hotel is comfortable and a perfect home away from home. There is a room service menu, which is quite good and only took approx 25mins to deliver. The only recommendation I would make for this hotel is request a room above the 10th floor to minimise the noise from the street. I will definitely stay at this hotel again next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service. Great Location. But needs a Refurb.”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Bris-Vegas
Reviews.Content: Surprised by size of room! Stayed in a 2 bedroom UNIT. Couldn't call it a hotel room. Great location. One block to Wynyard train station, 2 supermarkets (Coles and Woolworths), short walk to rocks and Circular Quay. One problem, the room really needed updating: frayed carpet in lounge, faulty airconditioner... Failings are easily out-weighed by properties many positives. Intend to use for family holiday. Great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Flip81
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with 3 friends in a large two bedroom apartment. The location was excellent, one block away from the Wynyard train station and a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel--very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AnitaJ2011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I would definitely stay here again. It was close to the Opera house, The Rocks, the central business district and the Sydney Harbor Bridge so, a great location. Also great for an extended stay as it had a kitchenette and nice sitting area. In addition, the staff were very accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation & location”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: We returned to the York after several years absence and were delighted that we did so. This time we booked a studio apartment but were upgraded without our request to a single bedroom apartment such as we had enjoyed before. Our request for a quiet apartment was met. We had not asked for a room with a view so our 12th floor apt did not have much of an outlook but that didn't worry us. The accommodation is fresh and clean and spacious, all facilities well placed and more than adequate. I do find being charged $24 @ day for the internet annoying but that is my only small gripe. The service is very pleasant, the parking excellent. Altogether very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and an excellent apartment - spoilt only by the crazy internet pricing”
Reviews.Author: RomanRemains
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a 2 bedroomed superior unit on the 25th Floor. A great unit with two balconies and partial views of the water. The pool and gym area are a great bonus and the staff were all efficient and helpful. Coles Supermarket at Wynyards Station provides all the essentials you will need and is open until midnight. Everything in the unit was spotless and the servicing was excellent. The only two negatives were the lack of any mini-bar price list (illegal?:), which was somewhat self defeating for the management as rather than having a nasty shock, we simply bought everything we needed from Coles AND the ridiculous prices for internet access - this led us to simply using the free access at Starbucks and on the ferries. Again, a huge black mark to management for their scroogeness. We would have no hesitation in staying here again if internet access was free!!.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to what the website promises”
Reviews.Author: lana a
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive 1bdroom apartment with harbour views (it is extra for harbour views). The website does stress that the rooms with harbour views are partial. We could not see a drop of water. Very disappointing as the main criteria I was looking for in a hotel room was a balcony with harbour views. I asked to be moved but they didn't have any other rooms available, so asked for a discount which I got with no troubles. Also booked a high floor away from the elevator and got a room on the 10th floor (out of 28) immediately adjacent to the elevator. There was a fair bit of broken glass on the balcony. There was holes in the pillowcases. The room was large and spacious, as promised, but quite outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, in every respect!”
Reviews.Author: macsla255349
Reviews.Content: Large, airy two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with full kitchen and a good sized living area opening onto a balcony with fabulous views. Even though it was expensive for two colleagues @ $330 for one night I can only think of positive things to say about this place: even the coffee selection had both espresso and decaf choices! Central to everything and staffed by friendly efficient people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: happysue_10
Reviews.Content: Spacious apartment with good sized balcony but terrible bed and pillows and the whole place needed a good clean. It was newly refurbished which meant some new furniture and fittings but other stuff woefully outdated - washing machine and dryer were terrible and ancient. Easy to walk to the Rocks, central city shopping, Darling Harbour, Opera House etc. Lots of street noise. Good eating spot downstairs (Japanese noodles). Overpriced overall.

Reviews.Title: “Greeat location, super friendly, clean apartment”
Reviews.Author: cglt76
Reviews.Content: Very spacious 2 bedroom apartment in central Sydney. Staff were super helpful at all times with all requests - and not just text book helpful. Had to transfer at short notice from another hotel due to renovations - staff gave clear parking and check in directions and price was cheaper by calling direct at the time than anything online. Close to Wynyard station, free city bus, supermarket and restaurants. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: Femme T
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times, mainly for the location, but it turned out being a nice hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the staff was very helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller1150
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel very convenient, located within walking distance to the Rocks and CBD. Lovely spacious room, very clean. Prompt check in. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melbshuffler
Reviews.Content: An awesome deluxe 2bdr apt on the 22 nd floor. Stunning harbour view. 2 huge balconies, study lounge 2 bathrooms. Spotlessly clean. Very friendly staff. Middle of the CBD. Will def be back.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance to The Rock in CBD”
Reviews.Author: jkl615
Reviews.Content: We got a deal with inclusive internet (wireless), in-house movie and secure parking which made this hotel a great value for money. However, I am still a bit worried that the advance "security" charge of ~$600 placed on my credit card will incur me interest that I wouldn't be able to claim back from the hotel. (NB, I paid for the account with another card but this charge was placed on the credit card I used to book the hotel in order to "secure the booking confirmation" and this charge is more than the tariff; I found this odd as all hotels I've stayed do not do this) Also, checking in is extremely difficult because of its location right in CBD. There was no way we could find the entrance to the parking tower or anywhere to even stand by to get down and check in for our access card. And so we paid for parking on the street to approach the reception. We stayed on the 6th floor and noises from the streets were still heard. There was no central heating and the heating air conditioner was rather loud. Apart from these, we found the room clean and modern with adequate space and a well-equiped kitchen (which we didn't make much use as the restaurants within walking distances were simply one of the world's best). We had complimentary newspaper (but only on two out of three mornings...strange). The pool and the sauna was literally next door so luckily no-one used it. We may come back (if price is still cheap) but will definitely ask for room at the highest floor available for booking next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Sydney and offers comfortable apartments with fully equipped kitchens. We also used the fitness center and swimming pool which were nice. Being walking distance from the Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the Wynyard Train station this hotel proved to be an ideal base for our adventures in the city.

Reviews.Title: “"The best & finest accommodation in Sydney"”
Reviews.Author: JeanSpajja
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The York by Swiss-Belhotel on numerous occasions. I highly recommend this beautiful establishment. Ideal location....close to the City Building District....close to the Harbour and only 10 minutes walking distance from Darling Harbour. I was sooo impressed by the friendly staff who made me feel most welcome.....very attentative, well mannered, efficient and always smiling. When I first entered the beautiful foyer....the music and the sparkling chandeliers and the friendly porter who greeted me.....made me feel as though I were in a different world. Suddenly the hussle & bustle of crowds outside were just a mere blur. It is soooo peaceful inside from the moment one steps into The York. Sunbaking beside the pool is euphoric bliss. After excercising in the gym...I decided to rest in the spa....which too is such a wonder....all this under the beautiful blue sky....amazing to relax in an Oasis above the 6th floor. It is truly an amazing place to stay at. Not only have I recommended the York by Swiss-Belhotel to all my colleagues, aquaintances, friends & family....I also highly recommend this beautiful establishment to all those for leasure, travel, business. I will be returning....soon. It is truly "Home away from Home". My desire is to become a regular guest at this establishment for all of the above. Sydney is the most beautiful, amazing & exciting city in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JenVan_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The York by Swiss-Belhotel on my wedding night and we could not have chosen a better place to stay. The reception staff were very courteous and helpful, giving me a great first impression as soon as we arrived. The porter was very obliging and prompt and attended to our needs straight away. I found that all staff were very friendly and attentive......I've stayed in many hotels and believe that any hotel could certainly learn something from the staff at The York by Swiss-Belhotel as they have service excellence! When we entered our room it smelt lovely and the rooms were very clean. Personally I am very particular about bathroom cleanliness and I was amazed at the high standard at The York. Our balconies had partial harbour views and great views of that part of the city. I have no hesitation in recommending this fine establishment to everyone. I have certainly recommended The York to my family, friends and work colleagues. I will definitely be staying here again and look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice. excellent during the week.Less so on the weekend”
Reviews.Author: over30stillcool
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant and some of the staff are exceptionally good . Fell down this time round with the staff on the desk who were female & Australian born who gave me the impression they had to work sat night & resented it no sincerity there. . As staying previously on a Sunday night the quality of sevice then & next day was excellent. faultless.in fact ( March 2011 ) I think a weekend manager or 2 needs to train up their staff. Also room needed lamp & power points fixed & clean with average tiles in bathroom i say needed thorough clean. 6 TV etc remote controls & all I could view was buy a movie option . Too hard to try really . Good value place. Excellent weekday service.Spa clean & hot but no bubbles.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly in the city”
Reviews.Author: Boodgen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend with my husband and 2 kids (both under 8) and it was eactly what we were looking for. Lots of space, serviced apartment in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great central Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: misslcp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks as part of my relocation package with the company I moved to Sydney with. My partnet and I were given a one bedroom apartment which was very spacious and all furnishings were to a high standard. The bed was large and very comfortable. Lots of wardrobe space and had all the essentials - washing machine, kitchen utensils etc you needed. The hotel is very centrally located in Sydney - 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay, 2 minutes walk to Wynard Station and 5 minutes walk to Darling Harbour. Close to all the tourist attractions as well as the CBD and transport. No nice views though - something which is a must in beautiful Sydney. Would have no qualms about staying here again and would recommend it to the business traveller in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Cadence05
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a short drive away from the Airport and very easy to find. Staff were very friendly and answered all of our queries. We were a family of 5 travelling (3 adults and 2 children) so a trundle bed was put in the lounge room. Trudle bed was surprisingly comfortable. Room was clean and we had glimpses of the Harbour. Large sliding doors opened onto two small balconies which was much nicer than being stuck in air-conditioning. All major attractions are within walking distance - The Rocks; Circular Quay; CBD; Queen Victoria Building; Harbour A bus stop for the double-decker sight seeing bus is just down the road. Only criticism would be the quality of the pillows in the master bedroom but all other family members happy with their bedding.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: localtraveller79
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The York for 5 nights in a 1 bedroom Executive Suite. From a location point of view, this place is perfect. It's literally a 5min walk to The Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay and the Pitt St Mall and perhaps a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. We were travelling with a small child and pushing a pram too so it's definitely easy to get around. The room itself was clean and tidy with modern furnishings and was very spacious. Some of the areas looked a little tired, but only if you are really wanting to be a critic would you notice this. The well functioning kitchen was appreciated! The lounge room had a large plasma and although a new lounge is definitely needed as it is rock hard (room 1104 if anyone is interested!) it is a very comfy space. The laundry is one of the small, tucked in behind a cupboard jobs, but with a washing machine, dryer and sink it was perfect for what we needed. A small clothesline would have been nice though. The laundry is located within the bathroom which is also a nice size and had plenty of steaming hot water! The toilet is separate with it's own sink which i give bonus points for!!! The balcony offered impressive views of the city even though we couldn't quite see the harbour (it didn't worry us). The little one loved running around out here and watching all the traffic and it was nice to have somewhere to sit outside with a glass of wine and people watch! The bedroom was a tight squeeze with a porta-cot included but without that it would have been spacious. There is another TV in here which is great. There were plenty of pillows to choose from and even though it was freezing, the blankets were toasty warm and smelt clean (not dusty like lots of other places!) I assumed the rooms wouldn't be serviced daily, but we received a top-up of tea, coffee, sugar etc each day as well as clean towels. The only negative of the place, which has been blogged about many times before, is the traffic noise. The door from the balcony into our bedroom, although locked, didn't quite close properly and you could definitely hear the noise. Even if this did close properly i doubt it would have made that much difference. Whilst it wasn't overwhelmingly loud, it's not the place to stay if you want a nice sleep in. If they double glazed the glass this place would be perfect. Overall, i would definitely recommend this place to anyone holidaying in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good apartments”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyS4
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a large apartment hotel then this is the place. All the facilities you need in a central location!

Reviews.Title: “Good except for room servicing which was not up to standard expected”
Reviews.Author: hallyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 2 weeks in a deluxe 13th floor studio apartment at the York. In our view the York is conveniently located for many things eg Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Wynyard Station, buses from Wnyard to the north shore, Woolworths and Coles Supermarkets etc etc. We also loved the apartment. It was spacious. It was well equipped. We had a good sized balcony with nice city views - we even had a sliver of harbour view from the balcony! Yes it was noisy, even with the doors/windows closed. If that is a concern for you then I'm sure there are many apartments in Sydney that have better sound insulation. Internally it was very quiet. What let it down for us was the room servicing. At best it was inconsistent: some days they replaced tea/coffee supplies other days they did not; some days they replaced flannels/towels and other days they left us short while on others days they left more than we needed. At worst the place was dirty. On the day we moved in we found pieces of food and an elastic band beneath the desk. In the whole of the 2 weeks we were there the tiled floors in the kitchen area and bathroom were not mopped once. I don't think the carpet was vaccumed once either. There were two noticeable stains on the pale beige carpet that I'm sure could have been removed if someone had tried - I was almost tempetd to have a go myself. If you removed the seats on the soaf there was food and other detrius underneath. And surfaces were left to gather dust. See our pictures. Basically the room servicing people did the absolute minimum, which is a shame as in all other respects the place was good. A minor thing - we found the reception staff a bit aloof. They were polite and helpful when asked but very few acknowledged you or smiled at you as you walked past. A smile, or a bit of recognition, does not cost much but it does give the impression that they care about you and appreciate you staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - best Sydney Apartments HUGE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheenat
Reviews.Content: Best apartments we have stayed at, and would not bother staying any where else now!! Perfect location 3 mins from Wynyard train station, The Rocks 5 min walk, DJ's Myers 5 mins walk clean tidy and serviced!!! Little on the noisy side and older building on the outside but modern interior!! HUGE!!!! Highly recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, but great location”
Reviews.Author: baliohyeh
Reviews.Content: The York is situated in an ideal location, the station, shopping centre and city attractions are all within a few kilometers radius. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with balcony. The lay out of the apartment was great, though the second bedroom is a bit small. The down side to this hotel is the disgusting mould in the shower, the state of the kitchen benches upon arrival (food spills from previous tenants), the wet washing still in the machine and dirty towel in cupboard from previous tenants and in particular the hotel spa. The spa had a thick layer of scum floating on the top and obviously not been cleaned in a long while. There is no view to speak of from the balcony and the traffic noise can be load if the doors are left open. Hotel staff were pleasant but in no way enthusiastic and lacked local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for heavenly morning walk over Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Aucklandlass
Reviews.Content: It was good to return to one of my favourite hotels in a price range where I did not have to see the bank manager first. A solid construction, it is quiet, there is no noise heard from other rooms next door or above which is a plus these days. Some of the most expensive hotel do not have adequate sound proofing and guests who allow their children to jump on beds or shower half the night can be most disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: MrsDeefer
Reviews.Content: - good location (near rocks and darling harbour and circular quay) i - even refurbished (1 bed exec) appartment is a bit tatty, tired and grimey (so I imagine the unrefurbished ones are pretty poor) - some staff a bit rude and pretentious - Washing machine and dryer harsh on clothes the hotel have also recently installed a new fire alarm system which is very sensitive. Guests will be charged $600 if the fire brigade is called out because of the alarm

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grara34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my sister's wedding the hotel itself is fantastic but the staff here somewhat rude and pretentious first up they had me arriving a day later even though I had confirmed two weeks prior then they wanted payment up front, their idea of servicing your rooms was just to empty your bins and pull up the sheets not change the bed or restock items in the room on my last day there I had reception call me three times through out the day confirming that I was checking out the next day,they need to realise that they are to look after us not the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Your stay here really depends on which apartment you get!”
Reviews.Author: flowerlady64
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe studio apartment and were, fortunately, given a refurbished apartment which was light, clean and very well equipped. The York is situated in the Central Business District so there is a lot of traffic noise and shouting some nights but we were over the swimming pool area so were shielded from the noise by having the pool area below us and trees in front of the balcony. Access to Wynyard Station, Coles supermarket, restaurants, Darling Harbour, The Rocks and Circular Quay is an easy walk. The staff were very helpful and I asked why some of the reviewers here were not happy with their room. I was told that the apartments are all privately owned and some owners have modernised and some haven't. You have to ask for a refurbished apartment. We were very pleased with ours and particularly the washer, dryer and lovely kitchen and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Ok appartments - good location”
Reviews.Author: HadP
Reviews.Content: The reviews, taken together, are right - good location (near rocks and darling harbour and circular quay) in business district - even refurbished (1 bed exec) appartment is a bit tatty, tired and grimey (so imagine the unrefurbished ones are pretty poor) - some staff a bit surley (clearning staff very helpful) Washing machine and dryer a bit basic and harsh on clothes Good things - pre-order to fill fridge - pool is in better shape than expected (sun on beds 11-2 only due to shadow from other buildings) - reasonably well equipped kitchen There are better appartments nearby - but more per night...so you get what you pay for (we will stay elsewhere next time at current rate differences - if york was cheaper we would return)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, staff willing to please!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler70816
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, & excellent location. Apt made it nice not to have to eat out. There was a grocery store and Starbucks one block away. Very clean and modern furnishings. There was an issue with my room type when I arrived. The next day the manager Leslie made sure I had the room I requested. This place definitely aims to please!! Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place to stay, staff could use an attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDC
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. The room was spacious, comfortable, and well equipped. The furnishings were in need of a thorough cleaning. Our only complaint was the lack of concern and responsiveness exhibited by many of the staff. We really had to lean hard on them go get things fixed or replaced. "I will send someone up," became a standing joke. The attitude problem seems to originate with the manager who seemed to insulate himself from direct interactions as much as possible. Even so, we would stay there again. We also stayed at Oaks Hyde Park on this trip, and it did not measure up to the York.

Reviews.Title: “Good property”
Reviews.Author: AwfulRussian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December 2010. Location is very good - right between the harbours. The view from the 9th floor was excellent, as well as huge private balcony. No downsides identified.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mastistyle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The York. It was great location-walking distance to to rocks, down the street form a train station. The apartments were perfect for us-had in room washer/dryer, kitchen, balcony. The rooms were clean. Make sure to ask for a rennovated room, away from the elevator. Also , we found a lower rate on a different site, and they were able to honor that when I called them directly.

Reviews.Title: “Like borrowing an apartment from an old friend”
Reviews.Author: DoctorM
Reviews.Content: Staying at The York is like borrowing an apartment from an old friend: an old friend who has worn furniture and drippy faucets. As noted in other reviews, this is an apartment building which serves as an extended stay hotel. You should expect minimum luxury services and outrageous prices for wireless internet. We stayed a week in Sydney with our college-aged students at the York in a fully furnished two bedroom apartment. The location is brilliant: within walking distance of the Circular Quay, The Rocks neighborhood, the Opera House, the Botanical Gardens, and just 3 minutes from Wynyard Station. The two Asian restaurants at street level serve high quality sushi and noodles and there is a Starbucks just a block away ( no free internet there either) for you coffee addicts. The view from our covered terrace on the 22nd floor was stunning and we ate meals there every day. The booking staff took extra effort to help us reserve reservations two months in advance for the famous New Year's Eve fireworks show. Their advice was spot-on perfect. Once you get used to the quirks, and don't have the expectation of impressing anyone, you will enjoy the many pleasures of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious living quarters”
Reviews.Author: mmandavis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sydney for the new year and had just come from a week in Melbourne after staying in a serviced apartment at the Medina Grand. I was blown away by how much more spacious than the Medina the York apartment was. We had a 2 bedroom unrefurbished executive apartment. It was really spacious. It had 3 balconies. We were in unit 90. While it did not have a view of the bridge for the fireworks, it did have a nice view of the harbor. I liked the open floor plan. It had another room with a couch and desk that could be used as a third bedroom. It came in handy one night when my husband started snoring. While the room may have been weathered as some reviewers stated, eg., the carpet was worn and bathroom had some wear and tear with rust, it was clean. It wasn't so worn as to render it uncomfortable. The room service was at times sporadic but it was the new year. The staff was friendly. The pool area was clean but one time there were no more clean towels so when I called they said someone would come up or I could come down to the front desk. I was lazy and didn't go down but no one came up. What I am saying is it is a serviced apartment. It's not the same as staying in a hotel. So don't have those expectations. I would definitely stay there again. Great location, within walking distance to the best area, the Rocks. Down the block from the Wynyard Station. So take the train from the airport. A Starbucks is down the block. A grocery story is a block and half away. Also in the train station area, there are plenty of places to buy food or have lunch or breakfast. I found as an american, the food in restaurants to be very expensive, especially now that our dollar is worth less than the Australian dollar. So being in a good location is key so you are close enough to eat in your apartment. We tried one of the noodle japanese restaurants just outside the York and it was good but not cheap, then again nothing was. We had a running joke that in Australia where Subway shops are plentiful, you don't get the $5 footlong but instead the $9 footlong. We were on the 16th floor and I don't understand the complaints about the noise. What do you expect when you stay in the city. It's air conditioned so if you shut the windows and doors, it is not loud at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for NYE”
Reviews.Author: PPDc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the York for NYE 2010. Wasn't sure about the serviced apartment style but finding a reasonably priced room is quite difficult in Sydney for the New Year. Check-in was simple. Stayed on a 7th floor studio. The room was quite spacious and clean. It had a balcony with a sitting table but we only had a view of the office building in front of us. Left the balcony door open once or twice to turn the A/C off - there is a lot of road noise. We found the kitchen fully equipped and functional, we had breakfast in the room every morning after stocking up at a nearby supermarket. There is no divide between the kitchen and the bedroom so the noise of the fridge compressor was noticeable at night. The bathroom was also large and functional. In general, the room was comfortable for a 5 night stay (and I am fairly picky). It is listed as 4 star (probably by Aussie standards) yet it would be 3 star in most places. Some aspects of the room could be updated (closets, washer/ dryer, radio) but none were any major issue. Location is a major plus. If you don't mind walking you can get to most of the tourist sites in 10-15 minutes. Walked to Darling Harbour for a NYE cruise with the wife in heels with no issue. Circular Quay, the Rocks, the Opera house and shopping on George and Pitt street are also short walks. There is no hotel restaurant/ bar but it wasn't an issue. The Japanese restaurant in the same building was good quality an price. Loads of eating choices within a short walk. There is a small gym and pool area was small but well done, although it doesn't get sunlight all through the day. Good base to get and see wonderful Sydney at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic stay - would return”
Reviews.Author: HappyTripperz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in one of the refurbished 2 beds - very spacious for 4 adults and 1 baby. Great location - obviously some traffic noise as it's in the CBD. Found the facilities excellent and very clean - staff were friendly and helpful. Also found the onsite parking very convenient. We had no complaints. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CMEWALK
Reviews.Content: We arrived from our long flight from LAX and what seemed like an even longer ride from the airport :) Our beautiful room was ready. The York is across the street from the Wynward metro stop so you can take the train very easily from the airport. We did not know how close it was so we took a taxi from the airport, but used the metro to go back to the airport. There is a Coles grocery in the metro station so you can pick up some breakfast items, water, snacks, etc. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) is around the corner and there is other great shopping around the hotel. You can also catch the free bus 555 to ride to Circular Quay to explore Sydney. The staff was very friendly and we had no issues We have breakfast at the Travelodge next door on the first day and it was pretty good, but cost $25 for buffet and there's not much on there. The rest of the time we prepared breakfast in our room. We also had takeout from the noodle place right next to the hotel and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here but ask for modern apartment!!!”
Reviews.Author: BenAndJerry72
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2pm and given a warm welcome. Got to the room (909) which was very well equipped but had old style wiring and old bathroom, there was also a very 'fusty' smell. I went straight down and told them i would like another room, afterall i had paid hard earned money and wanted it to be right! I was moved without a fuss into room 608........WOW!!! Very trendy orange decor, new washining machine in the tredy new bathroom and with a massive balcony you cantgo wrong! Yeah its noisey but your in the CBD and not the countryside. The swimming pool although small is on this level too which was very handy after walking around all day. Theres a starbucks 4 mins down the road, Wynyard tube 5mins, sydney harbour bridge and opera house 15mins walk - fantastic. Defo staying here again when we go back, any questions just email me. Thank you The York!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Starting Off Point to Explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tienas83
Reviews.Content: For 4 old college friends exploring Sydney and Australia for the first time, we could not have had a better location. The hotel was within walking distance of so much stuff, and the 2 bedroom unit we had that came with a pullout couch, full kitcken, etc was perfect. The staff, housekeeping, etc were very attentive, and it didnt cost a fortune. Good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SHUM8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location; right in between Darling Harbor and the Circular Quay and The Rocks area. We easily walked to the Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay, The Rocks, the Harbor Bridge one day, and the next day to Darling Harbor. The train station is just one block away if you want to save the $50 taxi fare to/from the airport. There's a theatre that's also within walking distance where we saw a great show, "Jersey Boys", so check to see what's on while you're there. It's a nice theatre. Having the kitchen facilities and the laundry was a nice bonus, as we made our own breakfast in the mornings. The room was nicely done and our balcony faced an alley, which cut down on the road noise as mentioned by other people. Hot tub was wonderful. Only negative was that the bath tub drained into the shower and overflowed onto the floor of the bathroom. The Greek restaurant a few blocks away was really good, even though service was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EireKiwi
Reviews.Content: To be honest after the wonderful reviews on trip advisor I was disappointed when we arrived at The York Swiss, the reception was very small and the staff seemed very young and inexperienced, we asked about our bill, an extra bed and a weekend travel ticket for bus and train at different stages of the weekend and each question seemed to cause the person behind the desk much confusion! The room itself was lovely, we had booked for 3 people and requested twin beds but got a double. The location of the hotel was excellent however the Travel lodge around the corner looked like a much better choice and I think that is where we will go the on our next visit. Again I loved the location but for what we paid I was let down by the hotel. I would only recommend this hotel if you got it for a very low price or other just as central hotels were too expensive or not available.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management and customer service”
Reviews.Author: jetlegger
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms themselves were fine, although the non-smoking accomodations had furniture and pillows that smelled of smoke, I found the service and management there very uncordial and somewhat rude in the end. They seem to disregard the privacy please door hangs on the door and just come into your room without much warning, one time the "mini-bar" checker basically gave one knock on the door, didn't wait for a response and just came barging in, luckily I was actually full dressed by then. No apologies, just that he has to check the mini-bar. Be very careful about the check out process, if they ask you if you want to be charged in US dollars instead of Australian dollars, say "no". What they don't disclose before charging you is their hyperinflated conversion and banking charge that ended up costing me an additional 6% of my total bill, plus, when asked if they could cancel this since they never fully disclosed the nature of the charge, they said that was fine, then charged me again in Australian dollars only to find that once I returned home to the states, they cancelled the Australian dollar charge and not the US dollar charge. When I called them to ask to correct the mix-up, the person who I talked to was basically laughing at me over the phone. Don't get screwed by this establishment, just don't bother staying here and go to another place that is more friendlier to travelers abroad. Very upset by them and left what should have been an incredible vacation to Australia with a bad sense of the people there.

Reviews.Title: “The best location but terrible housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: MsDucky
Reviews.Content: What a shame that this hotel has the best location for Circular Quay,The Rocks and shopping on George Street. Less than a block to Wynard Station for all train connections and a Woolworths for groceries.The lack of housekeeping was apparent upon entry into the studio suite. Carpets were dirty and frayed, the cupboards in the kitchen had food smudges and fingerprints on them and it looked like the floor in the bathroom had not been washed for days. Had to phone for hand soap as there was non. We had booked a refurbished, non smoking room but it was very disappointing for the price we paid. The bed was very comfortable and at least the sheets were clean.The front desk and bellman was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: K180108
Reviews.Content: It's an older building that looks like it's been remodeled into a hotel. It claims to have refurbished a lot of the apartments; however, they're not completed. We stayed in Rm 1602 (2-bdrm apartment) which was "refurbished"....needs a lot of work. Some of the furniture, art work, and paint is new....but the bathroom and common hallway are in dire need of paint and touch-ups. The patio door handle/lock is almost coming off which isn't great if traveling with young children, as in our case. Cleanliness is also a huge issue: moldy shower, hair in the shower on arrival, needed to be vacuumed on arrival (peanuts on the floor), dirty dishes in the cupboards, and the air conditioners spit out chunks of black fuzz so the filters obviously haven't been cleaned in ages. In terms of maintenance issues, the A/C in the master bedroom woke us up one night as it was pouring out water. The kitchen is ill-equipped....no microwavable dishes. THE POOL IS NOT HEATED (albeit it is October in Sydney, but the site states it's a heated pool....we beg to differ). The staff are friendly and helpful....they sent someone up to fix the A/C water leak in a timely manner the next day. The housekeeping staff are a bit dodgy....they wanted to clean our room at 11am one day and it wasn't a good time for us so asked them to come back in the afternoon. They replied, "Well, we're off at 12:30"....not impressed. How is that my problem as a guest? The location is pretty good, just a short walk to Circular Quay & Opera House, right in CBD with lots of amenities close-by.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious, self contained apartments”
Reviews.Author: LilSco24
Reviews.Content: The York Apartments are great serviced apartments in the heart of city. We booked a two bedroom apartment and stayed for two nights either side of our wedding day. We were specifically looking for somewhere close to the Church and big enough to handle the volume of people on the morning of the wedding (without breaking the bank). The two bedroom apartment was perfect for this. There is spacious living areas with ample seats/couches, whilst the two bedrooms (one double bedroom, one twin bedroom) were comfortable. A good option for people looking for a tidy, serviced apartment close to the Rocks area of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for business”
Reviews.Author: Sherry8itall
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and this place found by using the internet. pros: it was near my business meetings and I had a nice view of the water. cons: the noise factor and also my colleague I was traveling with did not get a view of the water. When booking a room, ask about the view and the noise. Maybe they can give you a better room. The staff was mostly great, except for one person and I think she was a temp.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: PoppyR0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the York apartments for a month, due to a family emergency. The apartments are located in a good position for the Circular Quay and Opera house, and a short walk to the shopping centre on George street. There is a Woolworths food shop close by for self catering needs. Our apartment was on the top floor and was outstanding, good views and well furnished. The trip proved somewhat stressful due to our family emergency, however we cannot praise the staff highly enough, nothing was too much trouble for them, in particular Brian, Abbie, and Stela, they made a huge difference to us in difficult times, thank you! I would have no hesitation in recommending this place. If you were to visit in the warmer months, there is a small pool, and a small gym. There is also a restaurant, though we never used it, as we prefered to cater for ourselves.They are making some renovations but nothing disturbed us during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend The York as a great place, perfect location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Aucklandlass
Reviews.Content: Stayed 17-19 March and was sad to leave. Location is excellent, great views and double glazing windows and doors made it quiet. Friendly, capable staff and pleasant rooms with all facilities required.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, the York Apartments were excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ruby067
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior one bedroom apartment and were delighted with both the room and the service. When we arrived after our 26 hour flights, staff offered us towels, shampoo etc to enable us to freshen up and use the pool/ spa facilities. (We had not previously discussed early access to our room). Apartment was VERY spacious and well-equipped . (Room 1604) Location was very convenient for Circular Quay, The Rocks, Harbour Bridge etc Not cheap, but good value for money. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: doctorfrank
Reviews.Content: Smack where we think you ought to be,10 mins from the rocks and circular quay,20 mins from cockle wharf/darling harbour. Nice spacious apartments but they do suffer from the traffic noise so if youre a light sleeper... Also as it's right in the business area you may get stressed dodging the suit's going to work etc......can be quite busy at street level mon-fri If I was coming here again think I would stop at manly

Reviews.Title: “Great location huge apartment”
Reviews.Author: kamus72
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay and forund the hotel in a great location for all the sites. the room was really spacious and comfortable although air conditioners were a bit noisy. Staff were friendly but could have been a bit more knowlegable at time. Pool great for the kids and a respite from sight seeing. Altogether a great location, great sized rooms for a family with the added bonus of a pool. On the expensive side but you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lots of room, bumbling service”
Reviews.Author: WmCT
Reviews.Content: My partner and i spent a week in Sydney at the Park Hotel. The positives are that it is in a great location near downtown, Circular Quay and Darlington Harbor. It's very nice to have an apartment, especially for those of us who want some privacy while we're traveling and for folks like us who keep different hours. It is nicely equipped including a stack washer/dryer in the bathroom and even full kitchen. The only negatives are the bumbling folks who run the place. They are certainly well-meaning and pleasant, but I knew we were in trouble when the desk clerk couldn't check us in because it was "too complicated" for him. The complication was that we changed our minds before we arrived and added 2 days to our stay. It haunted us the entire trip. In fact, we got a call from the front desk 2 days before we were to leave asking us if we needed a wake up call for the next day. No one ever figured out that we were staying 6 nights instead of 4. One day the maid never made it until well past the time we had settled in for the evening, which was the same day the fire alarm went off for a long period - very, very unpleasant. I'd recommend only if you want the convenience of an apartment and a great location. Don't expect good service or even intelligent service.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard”
Reviews.Author: ge90
Reviews.Content: Although charging full hotel prices, this property was substandard. When we checked in the room smelled of stale smoke, the bathroom sink was blocked (and could not be fixed until the next morning), there was no iron in the room and only about 6 coathangers. Generally a tired and stale property. No airconditioning in the corridors, the lifts were diabolically slow (with the staff locking off one of the three lifts for long periods). No restaurant. The one bedroom apartment was spacious, but the furnishings are tired and the sofa waqs as soft as a rock, the road noise was considerable, Capitalising on Sydney's chronic shortage of accomodation by charging way more than this property is worth.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for location”
Reviews.Author: Lokky_78
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been recently refurbished. The rooms are well appointed, dimensioned and is larger than the typical 4 star studio hotel room. However, it is 30 minutes walk to the Darling Harbour Convention Centre and approx 15 minutes walk to the QVB, therefore not what I would say centrally located. At the time of this stay, the room costed $190/night room only, whereas Novotel Darling Harbour was charging $160/night and I had previously paid $99 per night at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “A good, central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaxSpringer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom apartment. It had a good-sized lounge with kitchen area, and balcony. We stayed there for about 2 weeks over the New Year period. It worked out cheaper than nearby hotels. Very convenient - right by Wynyard station and about 10 mins walk to Circular Quay. I can't fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...Once Again!”
Reviews.Author: ck06
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The York on numerous occasions, I did not hesitate to recommend to family travelling to Sydney for a family wedding. We had 6 apartments booked in total and all of the same quality... which is hard to find in serviced apartments. All apartments huge in size, well equipped and great value for money. They have also recently refurbished the gym & foyer which had been well overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable suite in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AdrianBelfast
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because we found it to be as cheap or cheaper than the hotel rooms in the area. It has most of the amenities of a hotel (there are no breakfast facilities), plus the space and laundry facilities of an apartment. We were in a one bedroom suite, and although we'd requested a higher floor we were allocated a room on the sixth floor so it was noisy but handy for the pool! Renovations are ongoing. Our bathroom was very new and stylish and, although the lift area was being redecorated during our stay, this didn't bother us. On a couple of occasions, we chose to dine next door in the Travelodge, which had a great variety of food and great service at a reasonable price. The hotel is very conveniently located, about 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay from which various tour buses, trains and ferries depart. The closest stop on the train line is Wynyard Station, just down York Street. There is also a Coles supermarket in the station.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: juliemac100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apartments in December 2009 and had a wonderful stay. We were located on a high floor and had no problems with noise and a great view. Our apartment was very modern and clean. The staff were always polite and helpful. Gym equipment was was not available as this part of the hotel was being decorated during our stay - but hey, I can live with that! I would highly recommend these apartments for a family that wants to be within walking distance of the Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: CanberraC
Reviews.Content: Could have been a great stay as the apartment was spacious and the location was good. However, the property is very dated and shabby and in need of renovation. For the price we could have stayed in two rooms at a very nice centrally located hotel and had breakfast and parking included!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: yarravalley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom on the 21st floor. We found the room to be a great size, had 2 bathrooms, and a good kitchen. The location was fantastic. You could walk everywhere and wouldn't need a car. We caught the train from the airport and Wynyard station is just down the road. You can walk to the rocks, circular quay and darling harbour. It was great value (we thought). Were there for the rugby and we paid $300- for the room (which was $150- / couple) which I thought was great for Sydney. It does get a lot of traffic noise if you open the windows, but we slept with them shut and weren't disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: jj6870
Reviews.Content: needs a remodel, rooms had funny smell and the dryer didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Soelve
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with a really good location. Just a short walk to shopping centres and the Sydney Opera House. We could also enjoy an outdoor swimming pool and jacuzzi. Only bad thing was that the jacuzzi was quite cold the last to days of our stay, and the swimming pool was mostly in the shadow.

Reviews.Title: “the reviews are dated - this is under construction - a disaster”
Reviews.Author: MSBall
Reviews.Content: The lobby under scaffolding said it all. It was noisy due to the workmen updating the hotel years too late. This place is so dated and aging. The windows were so thin the wind came through and it sounded like we were sleeping on the Harbour Bridge at rushhour. The room was half redone so the furniture was modern and some of the fixtures but others were 30 years old. The bathroom shower stall door was taped together with masking tape. The fitness room was tiny; equipment was very old; most pieces not working. No internet, no business centre. The staff did their best but there was not much they could do at least not until renos are done. I use these reviews all the time and write this as my first because it was such an unfortunate experience. May you avoid the same.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DACKSON
Reviews.Content: I always stay in this apartment hotel when in Sydney because: - having originally been built in the 70s, the rooms are a generous size; - the location is fantatstic, at the bottom of town behind the rocks and next door to Wynard station; - The pool is great, although it loses sun around 4 / 5; - Room service is reasonable. I highly recommend it, although you do have to be aware of the bells that ring every Sunday morning in the church over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: KaitaiaAlison
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Rooms lovely and comfortable and all the necessary facilities. Good view of the city. Staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge apartment great location”
Reviews.Author: pigandtoad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and 2 children (aged 6 and 7) for 1 night and were impressed by the size of the apartment and its amenities. The master bedroom had an ensuite and small balcony and there was also a large balcony (with BBQ and outdoor setting) off the living area. Our kids also loved it and its location to the ferried. It is only a few minutes walk down The Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WalkersWA
Reviews.Content: What more can I add? Most of the past reviews have said it all. We booked a deluxe apartment to obtain a higher room (Don't expect a higher floor if you book a cheaper apartment) and it was spacious and comfortable. Bed was a little hard and there could have been more shelf space in the bathroom. As others have noted, a great location, half-way between the shops and Circular Quay, with the supermarket and Wynyard station close by. Friendly and helpful staff. Definitely will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: theverdict
Reviews.Content: A few minor points has lost The York a 5 rating. First being that check-in were checking us out a day early (this was human error on their part) as my confirmation and their computer both had the correct check-out date and the second being that wine, chocolates and flowers had been ordered for our room despite neither of us ordering them. We were quite happy to pay for the wine and chocolates (as these were gratefully received) but the flowers never arrived and we were billed for these twice. Both issues were efficiently dealt with and relatively minor but could really have done without them. Great accommodation and excellent location as all previously stated so no need to repeat. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sydney sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Brits at Home
Reviews.Content: Great location, not far from The Harbour Bridge, The Rocks and George Street shopping. Wonderful place to stay for the week with a washer & dryer in the bathroom and well equipped kitchen with full size fridge. You don't have to go out to eat as the kitchen has all the utensils and crockery you need, but there are endless choices of restaurants, bars and cafes within a short distance. Good size living room and dining area - great for a family with the two bedroom unit. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: muchtravelled62
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel is conveniently located close to tourist and business areas. Our apartment was spacious, very clean and well equipped complete laundry washer and drier. Although we were on the 10th floor we overlooked busy streets which were noisy. If you plan to stay there ask for an apartment as high as possible to reduce noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bluesplash
Reviews.Content: Great location which was the main reason why we chose the York Apartments. Price wise, you can't get much better for being so close to Darling harbor. Comfortable and large space for just 2 of us. Clean and reasonably modern. Not the best of views from our apartment, but you can't have everything. Many thanks to the staff for making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit - a real home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the York Apartments previously and had no hesitation in returning for our second and third visits. The apartments are spacious, spotlessly clean, offer a properly equipped practical kitchen area and balcony (although be prepared for some traffic noise when you are out there). Apartments also come with their own washer/dryer (ours was a little dated but who cares â€“ it worked!). There is also a small but very welcoming pool, large hot tub and small gym area on the 6th floor. Staff were friendly and helpful and apartment serviced daily to a high standard. They were also happy to store one suitcase for us, free of charge, when we went to Queensland for a week. After a welcoming reception area, the hallways leading to the apartments are a tad dreary and could really do with some brightening up, but donâ€™t let this put you off, as the apartments themselves are bright and airy. The location of the York is excellent, a few minutes walk from Wynyard station (direct link to airport) and a 10 -15 minute walk from the Rocks and Circular Quay (or one stop on the train). Our Tip: If you are going to visit several places in Sydney, buy a 7 day Travel Pass which also included the ferries to get around easily and at best value. I think that to purchase a Travel Pass which includes the ferries as well as bus and train you can only purchase this from Circular Quay but do double check.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience - Doesn't even come close to value for money”
Reviews.Author: WLeong
Reviews.Content: What others have said about the great location - near Circular Quay, the Rocks, Sydney Opera House and Wynyard Train Station - is all true. No problems with the kitchen amenities too. But that's where the honeymoon ends. The internet was a very pricey A$30 a day for unlimited use, although there was a weekly plan for A$125 (make sure you ask at the reception if youâ€™re staying that long). I had small quibbles such as not having a sponge to wash utensils and crockery, although oddly enough, dishwashing liquid was provided. A box of complimentary washing powder was promised at the time of booking but the front desk insisted that washing powder was chargeable from the first box onwards. Anyway, all these minor annoyances would have been easily forgiven if not for the following episodes with the washer. The nightmare began in earnest about 3 days into my stay when the staff had the washer in my apartment replaced. Somehow they thought it best to keep the guest in the dark about this matter. Unfortunately for myself, I had been piling up my soiled laundry in the old washer, and the maintenance staff did not even bother to check if there were any clothes inside before replacing the washer! Imagine my shock when I returned that night around 10pm to find all my clothes missing. I actually thought that someone had broken into the room before thinking that housekeeping might have sent the clothes for laundry service by mistake. In trying to query housekeeping at that moment, it was then that I discovered that housekeeping had gone home for the day â€“ so housekeeping, and also maintenance, are both not available 24/7. Anyway, the gentleman at the front desk finally managed to locate my clothes in the old washer which had been sent to some storage area. The case of the disappearing clothes is apparently the mystery-thriller that you get for A$215 a night. Never mind. A couple of days later, the simple act of using the washer turned out to have a rather complicated ending. All was well until the final spin cycle when the washer began spinning so violently that it sounded like a train roaring through the entire apartment.
