Worst of all, it started making a horrible metallic clacking noise and I was so worried that something was going to explode and send shrapnel flying around the bathroom. And then BOOM! A deathly silence ensued. When I steeled my nerves to peek into the bathroom, I found the dryer, which had been stacked on the washer, on the bathroom floor instead, lying on its side. The dryer had unplugged itself from the electrical socket and the plastic casing around its door had fallen out. It was like a scene from an earthquake zone. My colleague was completely speechless at the utter devastation in the bathroom. Needless to say, maintenance had knocked off for the day because it was already past 10pm. So there was nothing they could do until the following morning. What irked me even more was that the staff had the gall to suggest that I had overloaded the washer [It was only half full]. To cut a long story short, they promised to look into fixing the washer. I was probably a fool to have taken them at their word, because a few nights later, the same thing happened again when I tried washing my clothes a second time. This time, I deliberately reduced the washing load to just 2 pairs of jeans, and I took the additional precaution of lowering the machine spin rate. When I was woken up by another loud crash of the dryer in the bathroom, I knew then that the washer was beyond the point of redemption, and so was my impression of the York. My concluding advice is this: If you have a weak heart, or if you have a history of hypertension, or simply just looking for someplace that is value-for-money, the York is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, central and affordable apartments”
Reviews.Author: aboutandout
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic in the CBD. Its close to the harbour, and right next to Wynyard station (brilliant for airport link and most other trains), and a Coles supermarket in the station too. Its not glamorous accommodation, being very dreary in the public areas, but the rooms are spacious and clean, staff are really helpful, air-con effective, and the bathrooms are good with excellent showers and laundry. So there is everything you need, at a good price, as long as you are not looking for luxury (and as long as you get one of the refurbished rooms). Agree with others' comments about high internet costs, but there are some free wireless cafes nearby (or Starbucks nextdoor has cheap wireless by the hour). We were on 18th floor and had great views across the rooftops. City noise of course - because its bang in the middle of the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to base yourself for a Sydney holiday”
Reviews.Author: AussieKay
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney in March 2008 to see a production of Carmen at the Sydney Opera House and this was the perfect spot to base ourselves. Four adults in a 2 bedroom apartment with spacious lounge, dining and kitchen. Just a short stroll down the hill is all the inner CBD sights Sydney has to offer. The stroll back up the hill after a big meal and a few drinks wasn't nearly as invigorating, but we all felt the after dinner exercise was hardly worth worrying about. Our apartment had a balcony where you could enjoy a pre-dinner drink and watch the traffic going on and off the expressway. Traffic noise wasn't an issue at night, but we were fairly high up. There was also a washing machine and dryer in the apartment which was unexpected and useful. A huge bonus for this hotel is its proximity to Wynyard station. We flew into Sydney and instead of taxis, caught the train from the airport to Wynyard - it was then a very short walk to the Hotel. Also in the Wynyard station is a Coles Supermarket. It took me a while to locate it, but it is definitely there. We were able to stock up on breakfast ingredients and thus save more money. We had a lot of trouble finding a bottle shop nearby, but eventually located CBD Cellars in Carrington Street which sits down behind the bus area opposite Wynyard Station (about 5 minutes walk). The Room was well serviced and the staff on the front desk were very helpful and friendly. We arrived about an hour before check-in time, but were advised our room was ready and waiting for us. It might not be the cheapest place to stay but its proximity to the CBD, supermarket and bottle shop and also the size of the apartment (which made eating in your apartment a pleasure) all work towards making this an excellent accommodation choice next time you're in Sydney. We'll all be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “there are better options”
Reviews.Author: 3dom
Reviews.Content: this was one of 4 apt/hotels we stayed at during a one month trip to sydney in 1/09. it was easily the worst value. it had a nice well equiped kitchen, the room was big, the pool area was very nice. however much of this building feels very outdated. it has very noisy hallways, elevators and piping. there was even a slightly funky smell coming from what seemed to be a resturant ventiation shaft below our balcony. staff was nice. overall, this place is not terrible, but with so many better options, for even less money, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great for singles,couples and families”
Reviews.Author: canucks5
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is in an excellent location. Their pool and sauna facilities (outdoor rooftop) are amazing. We were traveling as a family of five adults and we were all very comfortable. The kitchen is fairly well equipped. Rooms are spacious and laundry facilities are in your unit. If there is a negative side it would be the extra charges for internet (seemed a bit high), coffee in the lobby which appears to be complimentary but is not, roll away cot (which is usually complimentary) etc. So in all it is a great place to stay, however, be prepared for extra charges for things that would normally be included at other hotels. We stayed a total of 3 nights. Grocery shopping near the hotel is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely NYE stay”
Reviews.Author: apawley
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 29th floor at the York in a two-bedroom apartment for 5 nights (including New Years Eve). It was our final stop on a mammoth tour of Oz and we were delighted with the accommodation. We had both a massive terrace off the kitchen and a large balcony off the main bedroom. The apartment was well (albeit bright!) decorated and very comfortable. The washing machine was broken upon arrival, yet they changed it immediately. Location is excellent equi-distant from both Darling Harbour and the Rocks and you can walk everywhere. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thought it represented very good value and would definately stay there again next time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tati_SE
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with other users who said that the location is great. It is indeed but on overage it is not the best value for money. The room is a bit outdated and small things like no refilling of toiletries until we ask someone to do it. For no reason Internet connection is ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for business in downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CraigAWashDC
Reviews.Content: My colleagues from work regularly stay at this hotel. It offers spacious and comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. The location is great - near Darling Harbour. We easily walked back from dining there. If I get to go back to Sydney with my family, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Give apartment hotels a try-best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugTampaHgl
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks on a cruise, our expectations were high. York knocked our socks off with the deluxe studio apartment. We were on the 6th floor and if outside on our spacious patio-there was street noise. We were, after all, in the heart of Sydney! But not after closing the sliding glass doors. We place a high value on quiet, size, good looks, safety, terrific king bed with bathroom almost larger than our cruise stateroom-incredible kitchen! We happened to mention we had trouble with the washer and the next day it was programmed for a speedier cycle for us. BTW-no fee laundry-in our bathroom. Staff were friendly and very accommodating. We were close to Everything and once we mastered the transport in town, we even took the rail to the gorgeous Blue Mtns. I would only recommend getting your emails at Woolworths-fast and $5! Hotels need to get 'real' on their computer/internet pricing. Apartment hotels are definitely what I'll be looking for from now on. If we didn't want to cook, there were local places next door.

Reviews.Title: “Introduction to Australian.”
Reviews.Author: mavistwinkle
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London (via Hong Kong) on 1st Dec 08. We were very travel weary and were greeted with a smile and a super efficient check in at the front desk. Just what you need when you've been up 27hrs! The room was very spacious and we soon made ourselves at home. The view from the 18th floor was great - a city skyline lit up with all the lights and noises you'd expect. The bed was very comfortable as were the sofas. The only minor issues we had were that the telephone in the bedroom didn't work and that one of the dining chairs broke - but as there were only 2 of us and we had 4 chairs this was hardly a big problem. The pool was nice - but if you are a little self conscious it may be best to use it out of office hours as it is overlooked by lots of bustling tall office blocks. Having said this there are plenty of loungers and canopies so sitting in the shade with a good book was a good retreat from the hustle and bustle of Sydney itself. A short stroll from Darling Harbour, The Botanical Gardens and all the shopping / eating / entertainment / transport links a traveller needs I would happily stay at the York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Stone_enge
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Room was very tidy and clean. The hotel has a very nice pool, spa and sauna. The location is 5-10 minutes walk from the Rocks and Circular Quay. Although on a map it appears close to a freeway, I could not see it or hear it at all from anywhere in the hotel. Only thing I really didn't like was the mirrors in the elevators. Made me feel a little uncomfortable when travelling with strangers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: abbeyk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the suites, its was an absolute pleasure staying there, rooms were big and spacious, had fantastic view from the balcony. Everything was clean and neat, bathrooms were super modern. Main bedroom had an en suite and guest bedroom had a separate bathroom. Living area and dining area were very lovely and comfortable. Kitchen had everything you needed. Pool was a welcomed treat after a long trip. Will definantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located self contained apartments”
Reviews.Author: BushbabeNsw
Reviews.Content: We chose the York as we were travelling with a toddler and wanted a self contained apartment which was walking distance to the city centre. We were not on a recreational trip to Sydney, and when we are we usually stay in self contained apartments out at Bondi. Our apartment had been partially renovated with fresh new carpet and paint in the living areas and bedroom.While the bathrooms and kitchen were a little dated they were very clean and perfectly adequate for our requirements. The apartment was quite spacious and while definately not 5 star it was very good value given its central location. If I was to recommend this hotel, I would suggest asking for one of the higher floors (we were on level 9) as the traffic noise was quite considerable when we had the windows open. The hotel is well located with respect to The Rocks and Darling Harbour however if you're planning to walk I would suggest comfortable shoes!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigPhilWarboys
Reviews.Content: Booked this because of the location and the need for two bedrooms for our family holiday. We were not dissapointed. Very well appointed and clean appartment and very helpful staff. The location is great with the Rocks opera house and harbour 10-15 mins away with Darling Harbour only 20 odd mins walk. Train station and supermarket just around the corner. Swimming pool, sauna and Jaccuzi comes in handy after a hard day being a tourist. Gym needs to be upgraded though as the machines didnt realy work. A very good place to stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing City Centre Apartments”
Reviews.Author: Mike258
Reviews.Content: At the end fo our epic Australian adventure we wanted to end on a high so booked this place. We were all amazed at just how great the accomodation was, I booked a 2 bedroom executive room with Study and it was like a film set, huge spacious rooms, 2 balconies, large kitchen area and lounge and an amazing view towards the Bridge. Although slightly expensive I reckon it was great value, you are within walking distance of everything, the staff were very helpful and freindly and you will be hard pressed to find better all round self catering accomodation anywhere in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: nader105
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were pleasantly surprised when we opened the apartment door. There are two reasons for this. Firstly, the tower was built in the 1970s and has a hideous, boring brown colour reminiscent of many of the high-rise buildings of that time. Secondly, we had seen a couple of bad reviews on TripAdvisor and we were sceptical about the place. We had booked the two bedroom apartment in the Deluxe Category for a decent price, considering it was the Australia Day long weekend. Upon entering the room, we found that it had been fully renovated and all of the appliances and furnishings were quite new. The apartment was spacious and tastefully decorated, with clean bathrooms and large balconies. This was a positive start. Another good point about this hotel was that with each apartment you book, you receive a free, secure undercover parking space. The car park is tight and somewhat confusing (because of the RESERVED signs that are placed in front of 90% of the spaces), but for a free spot so close to Circular Quay we can't complain. While the York is close to the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, it is at least a 20-30 minute walk to Darling Harbour and the Aquarium. Because we have already seen all of the major attractions in Darling Harbour, and because we normally drive to Sydney, I would most probably stay here again. For an overseas tourist however, they may consider staying somewhere more Central (ie somewhere in between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the York Hotel for a long weekend and had a wonderful time. We booked a one-bedroom appt on hotelclub.com, and were very pleased with the accommodation. The hotel even phoned a few days before to check we hadn't forgotton the booking. They were in easy walking distance (even with luggage) from Wynyard station, and were a 10 min walk from Darling Harbour, and 5 min walk from Circular Quay. We have been to Sydney a few times now, so knew which area we would be spending the most amount of time in for this trip, and it was perfect. Whilst we were on a low floor, and the view was not amazing, the noise from the traffic was not too bad. The pool and sauna were in a lovely setting and even in slightly cool weather it was worth a dip. We only had a small hassle with the power tripping in the appt, and that was rectified immediately once we had informed the management. Will definately stay there again, and have recommended it to colleagues at work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment and great location for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TandyWhitebits
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the York during Christmas and New Year and would thoroughly recommend it. The location is great as it's only minutes on foot from the QVB and city centre, Darling Harbour and of course, Circular Quay. Wynyard tube is only yards away which connects with trains going all over Sydney and there's also a Coles supermarket there which makes doing a food shop easy. When we arrived from our London flight at 10.30am we assumed we'd not be able to check in as it was still early, but actually the room was already ready for us and we were immediately made welcome by the really friendly staff. When booking the apartment we'd asked for a high quiet room (because we'd read some of the comments here about road noise etc). This is exactly what we got - and more! Our room was on the top floor and had brilliant panoramic views of the harbour - from Darling Harbour round to Luna Park and the Harbour bridge. Although we could see the bridge traffic, noise was never a problem and at night the city lights if anything made the view more impressive. Our room was very modern and clean and although we'd booked a one bedroom, it was actually a two bed with one closed off. There were two bathrooms to choose from and a brand new kitchen fitted with Miele appliances - we never were without the necessary utensils/glasses/plates etc either. The bedroom was large and all the rooms had quiet air-con. There were two balconies although only one was really suitable for sitting out on. However be aware that this apartment is very high up and some may find it a bit scary to go out and actually see how high up they really are. While the York isn't the cheapest place to stay (especially at New Year when we stayed there) it is worth it if your can afford it. We didn't have time to visit the pool or the gym, but found the rest of the hotel matched the quality of our apartment. The staff were always very polite and helpful and we even had a Christmas card and present thanking us for 'making do' on Christmas day so the cleaning staff could have a day off! All in all it's certainly somewhere we'd stay again. We've stayed at the Rendezvous Stafford and thought that was good, but if you can afford that little bit extra then stay here because it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobolo
Reviews.Content: The York Apartment Hotel is a near perfect place to stay in Sydney. We booked a 2-bedroom deluxe apartment and was upgraded to an Executive Two Bedroom / 2 Bathroom on the top floor. The view from the beautifully furnished apartment and the 2 balconies was spectacular. The kitchen had a full compliment of utensils, etc. When a bottle of wine packed in my luggage broke in transit, I really appreciated the washer and dryer in the unit. There is a small supermarket within a block as well as several restaurants nearby. Although The York is within walking distance to many attractions, there is a train station around the corner that goes to most other places in the CBD (central business district). We bought a day pass that included the train, buses, and ferries. We took the ferry to Manly late afternoon, had dinner in Manly, and returned to Sydney at night with a fantastic night view of the city and opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed, great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Bindoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights (a Saturday and Sunday) in mid April, 13th floor, Apartment #1308. We were very happy with our choice of accommodation and the apartment exceeded our expectations. We were not bothered by any traffic noise. We arrived and departed from nearby Wyndham Station - easy walk to the apartments. The Reception staff was friendly and helpful. We noted the apartments were under new management/ownership since February, part of the Swiss-Belhotel group. Our one bedroom apartment was quiet, attractively furnished in cream, beige and gold colorings. There was a reasonable sized balcony with views to the harbor bridge. Appliances included fridge/freezer, washing machine (powder provided for one wash), clothes dryer (excellent) and microwave/convection fan oven. Some instructions for the oven would have been useful. There was a good range of cooking equipment, quality glassware although the china was not as nice. We liked the bathroom too and the shower was excellent. The bedroom was not huge, but adequate with a large wardrobe. The apartments are well located, steps from the Rocks, short walk to the park by the bridge entrance and a slightly longer walk to most other places of interest. The spa pool and swimming pool are very attractive, we loved them. They were one of the best we saw/enjoyed in our six week vacation (mainly in USA). We would not hesitate to stay here next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: sumiyoshi
Reviews.Content: We have a special needs child, and anyplace we stay had to be perfect. The four of us stayed for three weeks thru Christmas and New Years. Not only was the location fantastic, but the staff was incredible in their flexibility to accomodate us and our needs. Super easy onto the Harbour bridge, everything in walking distance. Quite possibly the only bathtub in a hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dilligaf53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the York apartments for 2 nights - 15th and 16th Feb 2008. We had a 2 bedroomed apartment with 2 bathrooms, laundry facilities complete with washing machine and tumble dryer - which was a great help! The bedrooms were comfortable - a large master bedroom with 2 large double wardrobes with plenty of hangers, a built in safe and the bed was comfy too! The ensuite was well equipped with a nice large shower that worked well - not just a dribble of water! Both bathrooms came complete with the usual shampoo and shower gel, nice thick flannels and large clean towels. The 2nd bedroom had twin beds and equally as comfortable. The staff - especially the porter - Micha I think his name was, was extremely hellpful in every way, as were all the reception staff. The kitchen was well equipped with all cutlery and cockery for up to 6 pax, a large fridge, electric hob, microwave (I think it had) and a welcome pack consisting of water, a small carton of milk (I think) sugar etc... . In the kitchen there was a sliding french door onto a huge balcony which housed a table and 4 chairs. From the master bedroom there was another huge balcony complete with BBQ facilities which we didn't get a chance to use. The lounge too was large with a few sofas, tv, phone , and a lovely dining table large enough for a dinner party! The decor overall was a bit 70's and dated in cream and brown colours- but that didn't matter at all. We were on the 22nd floor - eek!! see photos! I have to say that our apartment was excellent in every way, close to all the sights - bridge, opera house, the Rocks etc and can highly recommend it for a few days (or longer) whilst in Sydney - be it for business or pleasure. The only slight negative was the fact that all cooking pots and frying pan were stainless steel, not good for frying or scrambled eggs! Washing up facilities were minimal, but the water was always hot! I cannot fault it! The rates too were reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Eigg
Reviews.Content: Mty partner and I stayed twice in November 07 - at the beginning of our visit to Australia, and again a the end - a total of 10 nights in the York. Everything was faultless and truly outstanding. On our return for our second visit we were given a penthouse apartment with terraces on two sides - fabulous!! No prizes for guessing where we will be staying on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, good value, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdbrickell
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem for long term stay in Sydney CBD. For business, I've spent many 2-3 week stays in the CBD and the York was the fifth place I've tried.. and where I'll stay from now on. Location is great, a block from the Wynward CityRail station. The staff is nice and willing to accomidate any request. They now offer broadband wireless internet at the very reasonable rate of $50 AUD/week. As long as you are on the 8th floor or above, street noise as mentioned in other reviews isn't any more than a typical urban city. Full kitchen and laundry en suite. Housekeeping efficent. VERY NICE BALCONIES, even pleasent during the winter on sunny days. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “York apartments and staff were excellant”
Reviews.Author: bribey
Reviews.Content: Protano's & Kelly Wigan England. We were in Australia for our daughters wedding and because the apartment was so spacious, it was used as the meeting place for eveyone who had travelled out there. We had a girls night before the wedding and then we had everyone around for drinks before setting off to see the fireworks at New Year. The apartment was cleaned every day and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. If we are ever lucky enough to reurn to Australia we will definitely return to the York Apartments as will some of the people who visited us there, they were very impressed. Thank you very much we had a memorable time in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers4
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a week over xmas 2007. This hotel is in an excellent location with great amenities. It is a 2 minute walk to train station and supermarket. A 10 minute walk into town or darling harbour or to the wharf (to catch ferry to manly) . We were on level 20 and our room was very clean , tidy and modern and was serviced every day. Our balcony (with outdoor table and chairs) had partial view of harbour bridge and other way was into city and centrepoint tower. There was no road noise. The pool facility was great with a shallow ledge perfect for our children (aged 2 & 5), many hotels we have stayed at recently with pools have not been suitable for kids so this was great. There was also a spa pool of good size and most times we were the only people in the pool. The staff were very helpful, we arrived late evening on an international flight and then had early morning check out on day we left. Housekeeper was very accomodating if we weren't going out till later in day. Definately will stay here again on our next visit to Sydney. We visited the aquirium, maritime museum, powerhouse musuem, opera house, went on monorail at Darling Harbour and mini train around botanic gardens. All great activities for all ages. Being busy time of year morning visits were best to avoid crowds then back to hotel for use of pool in afternoon. I recommend taking the train to Chatswood for those who like shopping. A simple xmas touch of santa hat filled with lollies made our children feel like home away from home during the festive season

Reviews.Title: “Good value for families, but caution advised...”
Reviews.Author: from-AZ-to-OZ
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the York at the end of July, and overall had a positive experience. The location was ideal -- within walking distance to the Rocks and Circular Quay. Our deluxe two bedroom 2 bath on the 21st floor had a decent partial view of the Harbor Bridge -- an advance request that the hotel staff kindly accommodated. Having a kitchen with all the amenities helped cut down some of our family's food budget, at least for breakfast. The rooms were nicely renovated, though we weren't thrilled with the choice of art and the extensive use of red in all furnishings. My only real beef was with the staff, who were not rude per se, but also not terribly pleasant or helpful either. You should especially be very very careful before signing your credit card slip at the check-out. They showed me my bill, which I examined and said it was fine. Subsequently they took my credit card to run it through, handed me the slip and in one breath, asked me to sign. Thankfully, by some divine intervention, I looked at the amount just before signing it, only to discover to my horror that it was $600 OVER the amount that was on my final bill! The young lady at the desk did not even apologize when I pointed it out to her. She simply said, "Oh, let me change that for you". Meanwhile I could partly see her co-worker/supervisor in the background watching and listening to what was going on. I will give them the benefit of the doubt and assume that it was not intentional or an organized plot. All I'm saying is, be careful, and review all charges and totals before you sign. Otherwise, enjoy the great location and request a higher floor to avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: isslandbabe
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a convienient place to stay in Sydney with free parking. The York filled the bill. It is right off the Harbour Bridge, just a block from the Wynyard metro stop. Make sure you get your bearings heading to the hotel for check in, or else you will wind your way around the CBD. There is not a really convienient/marked spot to pull in/park for check in. We just pulled over on the road and put on the hazards. Check in was a breeze, and we were routed to the parking garage behind the apartments. Our room was on the 8th floor, 801. We were unable to get a room with views of the water, but we did have a nice big tree that was growing below our window that offered somewhat of a view from the balcony. The room was a studio and very light and lively. There was a great kitchen with a stove, dishwasher, microwave, fridge, and utensils. There was a small dining table and chairs, as well as a couch, coffee table, small chair, and entertainment center with VCR and CD player. The bed was as hard as a rock. As always, the bathroom was the best feature. It had a great big sink that was shallow with a giant mirror and glass shelf. A nice hairdryer was tucked underneath.There was a separate glassd in shower and bathtub. There was also a small washing machine and dryer. The bathroom was very spacious! We do not recommend going to the restaurant for breakfast. It is not worth the $25 per person "buffet". They did serve a cooked breakfafst with eggs and bacon. Then there is a "buffet" with 2 kinds of bread, some fruit, yogurt, boxes of cereal, and 2 fruit juices. None of it was very good. The York is located within an convienient walk downhill to Circular Quay and the Rocks. It was a great location to get to where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: superQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in July on business. The Good : As per previous post, good location - very close to Rocks area and leisurely stroll away from Darling Harbour/CBD. Cafes/restaurants and seven elevens all within short walking distance. Free on site car parking from check in till 12 pm on day of check out. After 12 pm on day of check out, you pay $15.50. Very reasonable when compared with other hotel parking options. Apartment spacious (booked into the 1 bedroom), very clean, tastefully furnished and with everything you need. Kitchen not as well equipped as it could be, but still handy for making simple meals. Pool/spa area small, but clean and outfitted well. Pool small but heated. Heated spa very nice. Gym small with a few pieces of equipment - looked a little cramped to me. Service very pleasant and accommodating. Staff always asking if everything is OK and if you need help. The Not So Good : Difficult to locate especially when driving. Hotel located at the intersection of York and Margaret and if you miss it, you need to go one big round in the midst of busy Sydney traffic with its many narrow one way streets and weird traffic flows. Car park entrance on Margaret street, but you wouldn't know unless you asked. A bit noisy inside apartment and out. Constant traffic noise - not so bad if all windows and sliding doors closed, and if located on a high floor. As per previous post, balcony area not relaxing at all given the busy street frontage and associated noise. Within apartment itself, older model fridge gave off a constant low hum. Could hear plumbing and water heater noises from next apartment. All in all, a pleasant stay and would go back again if we got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent functional apartments, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mat789
Reviews.Content: Excellent functional apartments, great location

HotelInfo.Name: The York by Swiss-Belhotel
